reviews.sentence: A relaxing Christmas. Our second stay at Shangri La and can not fault our experience. Staff were at all times most helpful. 21 year old son considered the gym the best he had ever worked out in. Best breakfast. Pool attendants most helpful in sourcing lounges. Room was spacious. Shuttle bus sincerely appreciated. Wonderful lounge area with spectacular cocktail drink menu. 5 7pm canapés and drinks venue excellent. Spa visited by husband son was to their complete satisfaction. Thank you to the entire staff for a wonderful Christmas visit. we look forward to our next stay.

As great as it gets. The tower at this hotel is the original Shangri La property. The garden and polside wing were added later. I have never stayed in the tower because I abhor being locked in hermetically sealed rooms without fresh air or a balcony no matter how nice they are. Our room 473 in the garden wing had been recently redone and was perfect. Crisp lines nothing loud very subdued gorgeous bathroom with granite and marble an oversize king size bed and easy access to everything at the property. Room service was extraordinary please give my best wishes to Farida who takes the room service orders in the evening. The large gym was as nice and super clean as my home gym The Bay Club in Marin County California. The pool and polside service were five star all the way. All the restaurants exceeded our expectation but for breakfast The Line is a terrific breakfast experience. Singaporeans are foodies and this restaurant with fifteen different cooking and preparation stations and foods is exquisite. I realize these are pretty flowery words to describe a hotel but I stay in more than 120 hotels each year all around the world am very picky about what I like and what I do not like and I give this property five stars and great value for money.

Longest Staycation in my country. Singapore celebrates 50th Years Golden Jubilee this year which quite a few hotel offer promotions during the National or Independence Day. Got a good offer and stayed in their prestigious Valley Wing Rooms. Excellent Facilities and whole day snacks and drinks at the lounge for Valley Wing Guests. Breakfast items at the Summit Room were just as good and varied. More importantly personalised and good services by all staff in the Valley Wing whether check in butlers and housekeeping. Specially mentioned and applaud the following staff for their good if not excellent service. They were friendly helpful and served with passion and smile. Certainly an asset to the Organisation. They are Haridas Jason Catherina Martina Mel and Han Yang. Quoting from Arnold in Terminator I will be back to the hotel again. Indeed had a pampered and longest staycation in my home country. Majulah Singapura Forward Singapore for this year Golden Jubilee Year and hope to have another 50 more years of progress.
Nice room. Professional and friendly staff.
Excellent. The most amazing beautiful grounds unique Hotel in walking distance to shops Restaurants etc. in Orchard Road. Friendly staff excellent service.
We were at the Waterfall restaurant and extremely pleased with the service and quality of food.

I was having lunch at The Line on Fri and the server Manoj was extremely helpful. There was another lady at the counter who helped me too as I needed a nursing room and even though there was not proper nursing room available she brought me to the fitness club and I was able to nurse in peace there. Very good service from the staff really appreciate it.

One of the best hotel in Singapore. I have stayed many hotels at Singapore and this is the best experience I have ever had. The room at Tower Wing is newly renovated and the service of all staffs are excellent. I have also visited the newly renovated Horizon Club and it is fantastic too. The environment quality of food and drinks and the services of staffs are fantastic. If it is a must to find out a little mistake from the perfect environment I would say it would be better if there is fresh noodle cooking in the breakfast at Horizon Club.

Excellent all round hotel. 1. Corner balcony room overlooking the pool was perfect. Spacious and clean. Bed was superbly comfortable and pillows sheets were perfect2. Restaurants are all very good. Italian by the pool was really nice. Breakfasts are superb. Great choice for all tastes I had a full English with finishing touch of a Proseco daily3. Xmas dinner was not great. Just a regular buffet with many guests wearing shorts and T shirts while I donned a suit. Paled into insignificance compared with the Mandarin in KL4. New Years Eve party with live music was very god5. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout6. it is a short walk from Orchard Road with the ION Metro and Tangling. I walked loads overall to see the sights and earn breakfast7. Gym was exceptional and the trainer Hakim is a great guy8. Pool is so nice and even in the rain the cocktails were great.

The staff was excellent Hillary at reception went out of her way to bring us our room key when our room was ready. Our major complaint would be with the renovated Tower room. It is clearly designed for a single occupant. There is only space for one suitcase in the closet area and one comfortable chair to sit in. We had to put our second suitcase on the desk which was n’t ideal.
Me Johnny has Provided exceptionàl good service on two occasions he is an excellent employée of your famous hôtel.

Was having some issue with the coffee machine. Called frontdesk and staff said will expedite and send someone up to take a look. After about 20 minutes frontdesk called to check if anybody came up to look at it but nobody came. Managed to figure it out on my own at the end. Breakfast queue at The Line was long about 30 40 min wait time and breakfast was supposed to end at 11 am. But staff was professional and efficient in managing the crowd. Perhaps more could be done to ease the expected queue especially during weekends.

Overall great hotel. Only blemish was a couple of dinners at the Waterfall Italian restaurant. The food was terrific but the service was very poor. We had to try to flag down a waiter or waitress at every turn to order to get bread to refill water glasses to clear dirty dishes to get dessert etc. I personally think the restaurant was just understaffed as everyone seemed busy but just had too much to do. It unfortunately blemished my impression of the overall stay.

Your staff should be commended for their attentive and efficient customer service. In every interaction with your staff members I felt like our satisfaction was their ultimate priority. We thouroughly enjoyed our stay and would definately recommend your hotel to our family and friends.

I am totally impressed by your Line Restaurant waitress Yan Xin for going the extra mile in her excellent and caring service. She has done Shangri la proud by her exemplary service and even remembering us despite a lapse of several months. She should be commended for her excellent service.
We really appreciated Uma for her sincere and helpful service. She even shared with us the promotion info. Thumb up for her good service.

Perfect Hotel for a visit to Singapore. We stayed here for one night before heading off on a cruise I wish it had been longer. The hotel gardens are amazing and it has a good sized pool there is a health club and sauna steam room but I did not manage to use them. We were booked into the club level rooms and on entering the hotel we were escorted to the club lounge to check in. We had a lovely room in the tower wing. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The food and wine in the club lounge were of a high standard. I would stay here again and would recommend it.

Ordered the tomahawk which we had previously with medium rare donenes but the meat came out too rare staff took it back in and it came out overlooked. Meat was still good but would have been perfect if it was n’t over cooked. Chinese chef came out to speak to us good recovery with a dessert platter on the house. Pastas and pizzas were perfectly cooked. Service staff are also very attentive and well trained esp Tony. tina and Jean were also fridenly and polite. Would definitely be visiting again love the ambience and glad service and food standards are at its highest compared to when they opened.

Overall stay was pleasant. Your front desk staff who did our check. in is highly commendable for his thoughtfulness and excellent service. We were concerned about the several male guests in the lobby looking intoxicated at that hour we arrived at 2 am that morning. Your staff noted our concern and walked us to the lift lobby. That was very nice understanding of this staff. Highlight was Chi Spa particularly the expertise of Mauren team. Highly experienced and professional with a friendly personality. Downside We ordered room service on arrival. The fried chicken that came with the meal we ordered was not fresh which is alarming especially in a reputable hotel. As a chef I understand flavour is subjective but produce that is not fresh and tasted off is not acceptable. I did not eat it and left it aside. I left a note about the chicken and pushed the food trolley out to the corridor as advisedby your staff. I had asked your staff earlier if I should call and inform them to clear the trolley. But I was told that was not necessary as they would come around to pick it up. However in the early morning we were awakened by loud noises of birds chirping. We did not think much of it. It was only when we got ready and left the room we realised that the food trolley was not cleared and the birds had made a mess of the leftover food. The table the corridor was a mess. I alerted your front office staff. He was apologetic and told me that he will inform the manager to follow up with me. However there was no calls or follow up on this matter. As a chef we do not condone this in our restaurant as such I had high expectations for Shangri la. Thus disappointed.

I do staycations with club privileges in Singapore for my wedding anniversaries. So I will mainly highlight the difference I experienced in other hotels in compared to Shangri La. Shangri La gave a clean and classy impression. However the staff in the Horizon club were n’t personal besides an Indian staff who was very attentive. The rest of the club lounge staff showed more attention to Caucasian guests which was pretty unpleasant in my opinion. They were also not able to recognise us though it was our second day in the lounge. It was also a little disappointing to receive just a little cake on arrival which was n’t very tasty as we received better gifts ie a bottle of wine or champagne from other hotels. Though we put in a request for early check in and late check out it felt like the staff were not aware of these requests when we arrived. Housekeeping entered the room on both afternoons when we were in and it was a little alarming. They decorated the room nicely when we came however on the second day the flowers started to stink as the water was stale. I loved the drinks and food selection during the afternoon tea and evening cocktails. Breakfast at the Line was incredible. The general service at the main lobby was very warm and friendly as well. The rooms were bright and clean and the design of the room were well thought through. I also enjoyed the fact that we did n’t have to keep telling our room number when we went to collect complimentary carpark coupon at the concierge. Overall the experience would have been much better with more attentive staff. The rating for the staff increased based on the main lobby staff and concierge. It would otherwise be an average 3.

We impressed with the service by Andrea who recommended us a nice red wine to go with our meal. She also helped me to redeemed my voucher at the reception. John and Kathy the Tiger dining facilitators were also very atnentive and helpful. All were attentive.
I was ordering for myself and staff was very kind to advice that the dish may be too much for me so she recommended other dishes instead which made me very pleased.

Great hotel in a great location close to Orchard rd and shopping district. First time visitors to Singapore and we were not disappointed. Stayed 4 nights at the end of May 2018. We found it very easy to check in at the Shangri La. On arrival we were warmly greeted and provided with some fresh juice it was an easy process and they called my husband from the room at my request to come and meet in the lobby. The room was as expected. Very comfortable and air conditioned. I loved the toiletries. I had forgotten my toothbrush and was very pleased to find that there were toothbrushes and toothpaste in the toiletries included in the bathroom. So that is a big tick from me. I had booked a pool view which was very nice and the balcony overlooking the pool was a good size and the outdoor furniture was comfortable. Buffet breakfast was included with the room and was worth it to full up on food before heading out for the day. There was so much variety it was fresh and even a little gluten free section so big tick from me. Hubby loves his coffee though and was not so impressed with the coffee on offer so be prepared for that if you are also a coffee lover. He did get a pretty good coffee at the bar in the lobby so you may want to give that a go disclaimer 14audOn that note it was fairly expensive to eat drink in the hotel unles it was already included. so we tried to avoid that as much as possible. It was also very easy to walk to Orchard Rd and go shopping as well as get taxis to and from the hotel. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. You could probably just stay there and never leave. The staff are friendly and helpful. Service in general was great. Would stay here again.
Aby，Tharu service was excellent ‘ really helpful and delivered on time thanks for good service and everything. We will back again because of good service n food.
Pretap has provided us escusite service throughout our 3 day stay.

Breakfast at the line is always so crowded. I had to sit at the baking table for kids if I do not want to wait for normal table. Room recommended by account manager was different when I checked in. I had to change room again after I called in to concierge. It ’s troublesome for a family of 4 with 2 young kids.

Drank a can of tonic water already EXPIRED in Valley Wing. Stayed 3 nights 21May check in in their Valley Wing which is supposed to be the best among the 3 Wings. Conclusion. I would certainly look around other hotels the next time I visited Singapore. This review is long as I mentioned both pros and cons in different areas. For the expired drink I reported to the front desk manager when I checked out on 24May and provided him my room number. He promised to file my case so I wonder why there was no response from the hotel. The room is spacious and classic although some decor a bit dated. Bed and pillow are very very comfortable. Nespreso branded toiletry turndown service were all good. Air cond was too cold although I adjusted to 25 degree. Services in general was of very high quality especially Raja in the Valley Wing Champagne bar whose service was attentive and warm. It is a big contrast surprise to meeting a couple of staff on different dates not greeting smiling let alone give way as they walked in the middle on the pathway connecting the Valley Wing and Tower Wing. Very nice ambience in the Summit Room for breakfast. The Valley Wing soft boiled egg was very good. Would be better if not allowing children under certain age as it spoilt the quiet morning eg there was this 2 3 years old boy yelling and his mom followed him around their table attempting to feed him. Tried both Valley Wing club and Horizon club cocktail hour. Drink offered at Valley Wing was of higher quality. We were being served by staff in the Valley Wing vs self serve in the horizon club. However the canapés in the Horizon room is much much better than that in the Valley Wing at least for 2May. Those canapés in the Valley Wing was very wrong and tasted awful I seldom used this word in my review but could not find a substitution. Perhaps the usual chef was on leave. as the canapés for the following date 23May improved. Complimentary mini bar offered a good range of non alcoholic drink. I think the 4 cans of beers should be complimentary as well. Such services is offered by a number of lower end hotels. Those 4 cans of beer do not cost much but would impress the guests a lot better as this Wing was meant to be more prestige. Also a bit surprise fruit basket is not re filled daily. Not enough sockets in the room for nowadays travellers eg only one side of the bed had socket and no USB plug. Also got frustrated with their in room audio player after trying 15min. So I rang Services for 2 issues 1 to setup extension cord for my husband ’s C pan which power cord hang over my head the first night I checked in 2 to resolve the audio player although I followed all card instructions. The Service staff did a good job as he was quick to respond and setup the extension cord for me. He then contacted a second staff for the audio player. Later on we were told i the player ’s power cord was not connected ii. a player cable connecting to the TV was missing iii and the card instructions were outdated waste of my 15 min trying to set it upMy worst experience was to finding out I drank a can of EXPIRED tonic water from my room ’s mini bar on the evening 23May before checking out on 24May. I had a few big sips then found it tasted a bit strange. Checked the bottom and surprise to read it should be consumed in early May. The first thing on my mind was “ OMG. Expired drink. in Shangri la and in Valley Wing ”. This was totally unexpected and unaceptableI was quite worry as I had stomach problem and food allergy. I did not alarm hotel manager since at that moment I did not feel unwell physically. However I was psychologically very disturbed feeling that strange taste all the time. My husband monitored my situation through out the night to see if I was feeling alright. So both of us did not sleep well but we were checking out the next morning so need to wake up earlier than usual. I reported this incident with the tonic water can to the Valley Wing reception before checking out. A front desk manager I lost his business card handled my case with care and asked my room number. He promised to submit report for this case which he said he was embarrassed about. He then offered us complementary Taxi to the airport which was nice of him but nothing compared to what my husband and I went through the previous night.
Highest standards of service and equipment of the hotel I have been ever to visit. And the best quality with warmest service too.

I have been a regular guest of Valley Wing for more than 15 yrs. Over the years I have observed and experienced changes. sadly not all for the better. But one thing is certain and that ’s what kept me coming back. the butlers of Valley Wing. Edward Hussein Raja Khalil These familiar faces with their genuine hospitality is what Valley Wing is all about. Sadly Swaran is now transferred to Tower Wing. Valley Wing used to be exclusive and peaceful with the Harpist playing soft music we could relax and have a drink or busines discussion. The guests were mostly business people or older couples enjoying their retiring years. They bothered to dress respectfully in the lobby lounge. There were no such thing as ‘ STAYCATION ’ guests. Now the Valley Wing have guests with kids running around screaming and crying and their parents just allow them or ca n’t control them thus disturbing the peaceful ambience in the VW lounge. I noticed one instance where Raja tried to ask a guest with a crying child of about 4 who have been crying and screaming continuiously for more than 15 mins to calm the child down as he is really disturbing the peace of other guests. The woman just ignored him. Perhaps VW should not encourage Staycation guests with young kids. Valley Wing is unique. No other hotels worldwide can match up to what it has to offer. I am a frequent traveller and have stayed in many TOP hotels around the world. Even Aman resort can not match up to VW. I can only put it to it ’s how the Team in VW made the guests feel special. Through my observations To recover Valley Wing to its former glory or better Dress code should be strictly observed. The Reception team should politely informed Guests with kids or babies on checking in that the VW lounge is mainly for adults and the kids or babies can go to Buds in The Tower Wing where they will be happier. Perhaps the reception team can suggest to these guests that VW can provide baby and kids ‘ nannies ’ at a small cost. This service if provided will bring in more revenue to the hotel and the parents can really have their break in the luxury they seek. It will also be helpful if the reception team can gently remind new guests or staycation guests the dress code expected in the VW. There ’s a note in the room that mentioned this but how many guests especially the Chinese Guests who ca n’t understand English bother. That being said I am still very happy to return the VW every time I visit Singapore. it ’s the Team at the lobby lounge the breakfast room. Staffs with special recommendations Aswani Jagan Wei Long Mitchell the lounge Butlers Edward Hussein. Raja Khalil I call them The 4 Musketeers. They are now friends to me and to many regular guests. Also the door men and bell boy Krishnan with his broad smile white teeth shining through his dark complexion. Chanrai. Benji Hashim to name a few. They made VW so special and regular Guests keep returning because of them. I have to mention the Housekeeping and fruits Team. they remember me every time I return. Sadly I ca n’t remember all the names to recommend them. My famous last words People will forget what you say or what you do but they will never forget how you made them feel. Such is the effect the VW team managed to do so naturally for so Long. PS. It was good to see Nora back from her break. She has a calming effect in VW.
Overall good as always One thing I disliked is the change to the self service coffee machine at breakfast. The coffee is of very poor quality and I much preferred having the baristas make coffee.

My family and I enjoy dining here. Dinesh and the team do a very good job. Nice homely feel. And Jodie does a great job welcoming the guests. And the bq lobster at the lunch was fantastic. One request can you bring back the tomato based seafood soup at the buffet lunch. And very thoughtful to give a complimentary birthday cake for celebrations.

I had a very pleasant experience at your hotel. I would like to suggest that the hotel considers more Muslim Friendly features in the future such as a host pipe next to the toilet bowl like what they are doing in Japan Korea and Taiwan. Our Universitys Research Team is more than happy to be of assistance on this matter.

We ordered a garden view room and got a room to the street. After complaining we got a room described as an upgrade but was an downgrade. Small and old also showing to the street. The only difference was the access to the Lounge because the lady behind the desk tried her best.

Valley Wing Genuinely welcomed and duly served. 32 years ago I spent my honeymoon in a very special hotel in the English lake district. The Lodore Swiss Hotel owned and run by a Swiss family called England. The place oozed quality and professionalism and somewhere I would be happy to return to my first Shangri la. A lasting impression of Service was embedded in me from that point. Fast forward to August 2018 and the arrival at the Valley Wing of the Shangri la Hotel Singapore. Following a short hop down from Bangkok Shangri la Krungthep Wing. we arrived for a 2 night stay before our return to the UK. No sooner had we got out of the taxi we were greeted by the resplendently attired doorman eager to take the luggage before showing us into the entrance lobby. the cool lobby a real contrast to the heat of the outside. The delightful Sarah commenced the check in process before whisking us up to the 7th floor with adjoining rooms for our travelling companions. The facilities on offer could not fail to impress and the room itself was a haven of cool pastel coloured calm our young travelling companions were stuck for words although wow was heard quite a few times. The formalities completed we were invited to partake in a glass of champagne prior to afternoon tea service we could not really say no could we. So down to the lobby where we duly enjoyed the champagne followed shortly after with the delicate and delicious afternoon tea. Unbeknown to us prior to arriving in Singapore we had not been aware the 9th August was Singapore National Day during the evening cocktails we established that there was an event at the harbour concluding with fireworks. It was with the expert assistance and knowledge of Sarah that we were able to get to the harbour in time to enjoy the festivities. Our first breakfast in the Summit Room was superb the range of dishes whilst not the same as Next2 Bangkok or no doubt The Line Singapore was none the less extensive and of superb quality. I must give praise to the head waiter unfortunately I did not obtain his name who took our order for his skill and humour in guiding us through menu. Any request was met with a truly warming smile and a willingness to put as at ease which he managed effortlessly. I enquired about the availability of a none standard menu item for my breakfast the following morning this was duly noted and confirmed that it would not be a problem and in fact the item was served as requested the next day. The facilities at the Shangri la are extensive with a large swimming pool gymnasium and beautiful landscaped grounds. If I were to offer any criticism though it would be the apparent lack at times of sun beds for the number of guests. Our departure and return to the UK was scheduled for 2340 hrs. We arranged for a slightly later checkout at 1 pm but were able to avail ourselves of all the facilities in the Valley Wing which allowed us to shower and change in the health club. We enjoyed afternoon tea in the garden where we were briefly entertained by a very cheeky squirrel. All members of the Shangri la Valley Wing staff we had contact with for whatever reason were a credit to the hotel their eagerness to please was evident from the moment we arrived to the sad point of our departure. I must mention in particular Sarah Jada apologies if incorrectly spelt and the Head waiter in the Summit Room. To arrive at a new destination and unfamiliar hotel to be put at ease straight away to be made to feel you are truly valued makes for a desire to return sooner rather than later. So why mention the Lodore Swiss Hotel well it is all about Service Service Service and like the former the Valley Wing provided it in abundance another lasting impression is imprinted in me I look forward to my return. I have found my New Shangri la.

As I frequently go to Shangri la for business purposes not once have I receive bad reception. Staff there are always swing and greeting u whenever u come across them. Most importantly is that they are helpful and will try to solve or help u with whatever problems u might face in their vicinity.

I did my advance check in via mobile for fuss free check in. Upon arrival I was queueing for my turn when later on I happen to see the big Mobile Check in signage on the very left counter. Since the staff still attending to a customer so I wait. When it ’s my turn staff Lyn asked me if I ’m for check in as the line for check in was at the other side. I mentioned to her that I ’m here due to the mobile check in. She look reluctant to serve while telling me that ” check in is actually there but She can still do it here ”. She also returned my Identification card by placing on the counter without telling me. She then hand over the cards for the room and THATS ITNo brief on my Famiky fun package eg. what time buffet starts and where my kid can enjoy the kids play area and no ticket or card required and breakfast serve where and all the other basic information that I normally receive upon check in. Seems like all I have to figure myself. Honestly the standard between here and Shangri la Sentosa is way so much different. My experience In Shangri la Sentosa is much more welcoming. Well of course she took effort to ask me if I prefer a cake to be serve for my kid birthday. Other than that I ’m lost. Lastly she asked if I need her to show me the way and I said Please. And suddenly she walk out and went inside the office which is located behind the counter. Inside the room. Room was fantastic and thank u for the cake and fruits. Appreciate alot. Then when I called to ask if I can request for late check out the staff who answered my call was talking way too fast and rushing for every answer that I asked her. Anyway I ’m not able to check out late. And was told to try again tomorrow. I just hope the rest of my stay will be a better one.

Excellent. The Shangri La never fails to please. Excellent rooms in the garden wing would be hard to improve on service. Spotlessly clean and efficient. Staff anticipated our needs and remembered our preferences. Ca n’t think of better service anywhere in Singapore.

Nice and newly renovated Tower wing room. Stayed 1N in a tower wing club deluxe room for a quick local getaway. Room is recently renovated with a nice modern touch vs some Shang properties in this part of the world which is a blast from the 80s. Sound insulation is great and I slept well despite being a light sleeper. Service is polite discreet and efficient as is the hallmark of Singapore hospitality but not as warm and inviting as you would experienced in Shang KL or JKTLocation is a bit off but there is a shuttle to Orchard mrt station that runs quite frequently. You can walk there too in 10 15mins barring bad weather or you have young or old in tow. Onsite FB is great and the horizon club provides food or snacks through the day. Only complaint is the breakfast offering in th horizon club food are cold especially bad is the rubbery and hard as stone streaky bacon. Overall is a great property located in a serene and tranquil location and great to stay if you do n’t mind a bit of commuting hassle.
Location is good. Provides shuttle services to shopping centers nearby. Lovely hotel staff.

It was well organized and food was good. Compliment has to given to Peiting or Rachel for the excellent service. She has been very accommodative and service orientated. A compliment also to the captain and his team serving my guests.

Another great stay with some extra special experiences. Upon welcome was given the opportunity for some extra complimentary bar items. And was invited by a colleague to have breakfast at the Club level which was nice and calming and a great start to the day. Staff was friendly with all interchanging greetings with me I value that highlyRated breakfast in The Line downstairs a three mostly due to the number of people and openness of space not creating a sense of calm. During hectic travel schedules I crave calmness and serenity to balance my packed agenda. Some higher partitions with plants might help. Food as usual was great with choice spoiling me forever.

Great Time. I was helping out my silversea team. As I was one of the organisers. I was walmly attended and noticed the harwork rendered by these 3 staffs Nithya Marcus and Naima. Highly recommend their warmth service and professionalism. Thank you guys.

The night was amazing. The room been decorated nicely by Shang palace team. Attending my friend birthday celebration with full of happiness and excitement. Thanks to mayling Chingye and Judy for their excellent service and experience.

I held a birthday celebration for my daughter in Shangri la Hotel on 22 June 2019. The event went very well. My guests were all well looked after and I was most impressed with the services provided by your capable staff. Ms I Lyn Tan. Senior event manager. I Lyn always wore a bright smile on her face and ever so calm and composed with all matters. She was extremely knowledgeable with all the details leading up to the event. She was always approachable and helpful above all extremely efficient. I was totally at ease during the planning of the event as I know I was under the capable hands of I Lyn. I Lyn personally waited for my elderly mother at the hotel entrance with the wheelchair ready. She escorted my mother with my other family members to the event venue. This simple yet professional gesture of hers touched me and my family. I have been organising birthday celebration in Shangri la for the past four years. I Lyn was the only event manager who had done this so well. Mr Laurenz Banquet manager. This stout young man was a smart gentle giant. He was totally attentive and very helpful during the event. He was extremely courteous and able to resolve problem in no time. He paid attention to all details and was very careful when handling all matters. I was particularly impressed when he took the trouble to make sure that the chef cut and preserve the birthday cake according to my instruction consulting me when in doubt. The following are three other capable staff that I have encountered during the event 1. Mr Wen Bin Very polite and capable staff. He frequently checked on my elderly mother making sure that her drinks were warm offering a fresh cup of warm drink readily. Such simple gesture goes a long way reflecting the high hospitality standard of the hotel. 2. Ms Rushia. Another well trained staff. She was very kind and polite making sure that all guests were well looked after. She wore a beautiful smile paying attention to details and never rushed the guests offering her help ever so readily. 3. Ms Syarfikha a young attentive staff who was very kind and helpful to me during the event. As with all events there maybe minor hiccups like the florists got the table flower colours wrong or extra piece of furniture required etc. Nevertheless these were all rectify quickly and competently showing the resilience of the hotel to service excellence. This by itself impressed me too. Overall I would like to congratulate Shangri la Hotel Singapore for the hospitality excellence you have exhibited. As I was walking beside the swimming pool telling my daughter that I need to get to Garden Terrace your ground staff overheard me and immediately directed me the best route to get there. I walked along the walkway getting to Dutch Pavilion your gardener greeted me with a friendly smile and offered me direction without me asking. My heartiest thanks to your staff especially I Lyn and Laurenz for making my recent birthday celebration event such a pleasant and memorable one. Thank you again.
Jesie was brilliant and very kind. She goes above and beyond the expectations for great service. Much obliged.
Johnny the concierge was great. As was the two ladies who supported our event each day by providing snacks coffee and room clean up. I wish I remembered their names outstanding.

I am providing a score of 4 as our overall experience was very good. However we did have a number of poor experiences as well regarding the advice we received from the concierge and some poor food experiences. I have made this aware to the staff of Shangri La Singapore.

Attentive staff throughout my stay. Room restaurants and pool was up to expected levels for Shang. I did check out early on Saturday though my flight was in the evening. I went to town for lunch and left my luggage at the concierge. Upon my return I request a Surau for my afternoon prayers and was directed to the Butlers Surau in the Valley Wing. It was sufficient for my purposes but I feel you should improve the Surau facilities for your Muslim guests.
Tuling May Ling Su Lan provide us with excellent service.

We had the lunch buffet for Christmas Eve and was blown away by the food and service. In particular we would like to commend Crystal who showed us to our seat Niki who waited on us and Friedrich who was in charge of carving the turkey and roast beef. They were both so joyful and welcoming. Thank you very much for the wonderful experience at The Line.
As always 1st class service. That ’s why i keep coming back.

Absolutely love our stay here. We are already looking forward to our next anniversary stay and many that come after. The staff at Valley Wing are dedicated to providing the best service. From breakfast at the Summit Room to high tea and gin they also look cheery and never rushed. They hold conversations well and made sure you feel at home at Shangrila. For example I was asking your staff who prepared our gin why does he always look so happy and grateful. He told me he has many things to be grateful for and Shangrila has provided him with much opportunities. I thought Shangrila must have done something right in training of their staff. Pity I can not remember his name after a few glasses of champagne and gin but I will look for him during my next stay. My new husband and I would also like to recognise and thank Michele ’s effort in planning our wedding dinner banquet on 21 Dec 2019. One year of planning has paid off and we received so much positive feedback from our guests that came that day. Thank you for your receptiveness to my ideas and making sure the wedding dinner went through smoothly that day. We hope to have you to plan future celebrations if possible. Once again thank you Shangrila. It is about 359 days to our next stay at your property.

PositiveWe had a very good experiance during check in process. Welcome drink to wake us up from a long tripCheckin staff was very professional and explained clearly the process. The lobby is huge and very impressive esp with Christmas decorNegativeCals from room were not answeres on the checkout time. At checkout voucher for second room was not offset against the bills until asked. OveralThe hotel staff are the real star.
Recce cleaner for room 1735 and 1736 thank you for your good service.

My rating would have been 5 if not for the fact that the room cleaning service was very inconsistent. On some days there was a bathroom floor towel other days there was not and it was the same situation with hand towels. To be clear the bathroom was clean it was just disconcerting in relation to the issues raised. That said to more positive matters the christmas souvenirs and card left by the housekeeping team on Christmas Day was a very nice touch. Much appreciated.

Perhaps the most attentive housekeeping staff from all the hotels I ’ve stayed at. There was always the right amount of towels and amenities as well as being very clean for all of our stays. Jordan in particular has always been polite and shown a great attitude. He recognises us every time we stay at the Shangri la and has always made sure we had everything we needed. An asset to the hotel for sure. Will look forward to this great service again.

Wonderful Horizon Club staff. This is a long overdue review but better late than never. I had very relaxing stay at Shangril La Hotel and it is mostly due to the wonderful service of the Horizon Club. Since we were there for rest we enjoyed the amenities of the Horizon Club and was there for high tea and cocktails most of the time. I personally liked the concept of having a separate Family Corner for families that bring their children to the lounge. I would like to thank Viola Gian and Ela for taking care of us during our stay. No request was too complicated for them and they always served us with a smile. Viola especially took note of the cheese I took a liking to and asked the kitchen if they had more in stock for me. These are little things that make a difference in making a stay memorable for a guest and I must say that the Horizon Club staff passed with flying colors. I can not wait to return to Shangri La Singapore this year.
Very Good. Very good. Could have had more staff around the pool area.

Thank you it was one of the most unforgettable places we ever visited. High level of service super cleanliness in the rooms it was very important for me due to stay with 4m old baby perfect restaurants Japanese and Chinese and Italian ones breakfast at “ Horizon ” on the 24th floor was amazing and comfortable due to special children ’s corner our 2y old son liked it very much indoor kid ’s club also very clean I was pleasantly surprised that all the kids are tested for the high temperature and the hands are cleaned by antiseptics. outdoor playground unfortunately was under reconstruction swimming pool was enough big and clean I would like to focus your attention our eldest son was running around the pool area and suddenly fall down due to wet floor I would like to thank your staff for the immediate help but if the floor was changed for anti slip coating it would make the swimming zone more safe garden very calm place but sometimes mosquitoes bit us.

Amazing service by the pool this afternoon. Nesh did a fantastic job of creating an off the menu cocktail for us that was perfection. Really went above and beyond to make sure our relaxation time was terrific. A service by Nesh and Mathew.

MMathew was excellent. He provided us with options and alternatives for my Daughter as she did n’t like the ice cream we purchased. Well spoken courteous and extremely prompt. Could n’t rate his service more highly. More staff should be like him. I even praised him to the manager of Waterfall cafe as he was brilliant. Helped with restaurant reservations for 2 evenings at waterfall. Excellent.

Forest paradise in the middle of the city. The breakfast buffet was the largest we have ever seen. it is just not huge but very well chosen articles and the quality was excellent. Only complaint about the breakfast is the coffee service. You can make much better coffee by yourself using Nespreso machines which are available there. Room and bathroom very nicely renovated. Only complain in that sector comes from the age of the hotel. Almost 50 years ago room height was lower and there is not enough natural light in the room. One thing I suggest is please remove those large writing desks which are totally blocking the windows and takes the last spacious feeling away. The incoming experience was one the best. Whole lobby level staff is so awesome. Every time we were around there someone noticed us and came to talk. There was no difference who was it. Everyone in there behaved the same. Final conclusion was the late checkout until 5 pm combined with afternoon tea service. It was really nice to stay at hotel premises when our flight left just before midnight. Also the lobby atmosphere and design makes blissful feeling. Then the garden or how to describe that paradise around the pool. Funny feeling to be few hundred meters from Orchard street and totally inside a forest. Shuttle was a nice addition though it might go more often and directly to Orchard MRTWhen we wandered around the hotel we thought that this would be a nice place for a family vacation if you have kids. Like a resort but in the middle of the city.
Having no experience of Japanese dining we were very grateful for the advice we were given by the staff particularly Ericand Krystal.

One staff insisted that my hubby should change to a covered shoes before entering. That puts us off. We did nt enter of course. My hubby was embarrassed by the way she spoke. We were there on 14320 5 pm. The tea time at 2 pm staff was really nice she was polite and did nt make any comment.

Used to be the best in the world not now. My wife and I have stayed at the Shangri la every two or three years since 1987. For many years it was the hotel of choice for professionals especially when staying in the Horizon Club. For the extra cost one got excellent well appointed rooms and a degree of exclusive service in the breakfast and Club areas On our recent trip we found that the room had been redesigned probably by someone who had never stayed there. The bathroom is smaller with the shower in a so called wet room area with a slippery floor which could be dangerous. A former feature used to be the full size bath tub in which one could relax but this has been replaced by a small steep sided one which is difficult to get out of. For some reason a small induction hob has been added to the entrance area. The kind of people who used to frequent the Shangri la are happy to pay to eat in restaurants and do not want the smell of cooking in their bedrooms. We requested twin beds but were given one enormous double bed. Breakfast is now only served in the Line restaurant next to the pool. This is self service sitting at plastic tables. There is nothing wrong with the food and the choice is enormous but the atmosphere is similar to the concourse at Victoria Station in London but with a few extra screaming kids. Gone are the white linen tablecloths and the smiling service. Similarly the Club lounge no longer has friendly waiters carrying bottles of wine to top up your glass. The wine comes out of a self service dispensing machine. The staff are efficient but impersonal and many of them have poor language skills clearly not Singaporean. The atmosphere remains outstanding at the Italian Waterfall restaurant with well prepared food well served and accompanied by a wide choice of wines.

Big room with nice balcony with a massive well maintained landscape. Great indoor kido playground with the newly revamped outdoor splash zone was a hit with my 3 year old. Staycation package was attractive though the buffet lunch experience was bad with too many ungracious dining guests. Service staff seems overwhelmed with the sheer workload. Love the local breakfast spread and the quieter environment on Sunday. Personable service in Buds with rather flat and superficial services elsewhere. Room and bathroom are showing age pillows and bed not the most comfortable. But still a pleasant stay overall.

Poor billing experience due to the fact that I prefer to pay on a direct debit card. I have made a number of extensions to my stay however both communication and the billing experience have been poor. Failure to recognize my status as a customer. It seems that my choice of using a debit card has caused management issues with ensuring I pay my room charges. It would have been helpful had the correct amounts be taken from my card at the beginning of my stay and then clear communication as to what payments are required on each stay extension. Staff should be trained to make logical and sensitive decisions based on quests status taking into account their specific choice of payment before refusing to reissue room cards.
